question-1: What is the publication year of the study?
question-2: Which dataset(s) were used in the study? (List all)
question-3: What is the size of each dataset used (number of instances)?
question-4: What machine learning technique(s) were employed in the study? (List all)
question-5:
For each machine learning technique used:
a. What was the overall prediction accuracy?
b. What was the precision?
c. What was the recall?
d. What was the F1-score?
e. What was the AUC-ROC value (if reported)?
question-6: What software metrics were used as features for prediction? (List all)
question-7:
For each software metric used:
a. What was its individual predictive power (if reported)?
b. Was it ranked or weighted in terms of importance? If so, what was its rank or weight?
question-8: What performance measures were used to evaluate the model(s)? (List all)
question-9: Were any dimensionality reduction techniques (e.g., PCA) used? If so, which ones?
question-10: Were any ensemble methods used? If so, which ones?
question-11: Was cross-validation used? If so, what type and how many folds?
question-12: What was the ratio of defective to non-defective modules in each dataset used?
question-13: Were any data preprocessing techniques applied? If so, which ones?
question-14: Was feature selection performed? If so, what method was used?
question-15: Were any comparative analyses performed with other studies or techniques? If so, with which ones?
question-16: What programming language or tool was used to implement the machine learning models?
question-17: Were there any specific strengths or weaknesses identified for each machine learning technique used?
question-18: Was the study focused on within-project or cross-project defect prediction?
question-19: Were any novel or hybrid techniques proposed? If so, describe them briefly.
question-20: What conclusions were drawn about the effectiveness of different machine learning techniques?
question-21: Were any specific challenges or limitations mentioned regarding the use of machine learning for bug prediction?
question-22: Was there any analysis of computational complexity or runtime performance of the techniques used?
question-23: Were any specific recommendations made for future research in this area?
question-24: Was transfer learning or domain adaptation considered in the study?
question-25: Were any visualizations or graphical representations of the results provided? If so, what types?
question-26: Was there any discussion on the interpretability of the machine learning models used?
question-27: Were any industrial or real-world applications of the techniques discussed?
question-28: Was there any analysis of the cost-effectiveness of the bug prediction approach?
question-29: Were any comparisons made between traditional software metrics and more advanced or domain-specific metrics?
question-30: Was there any discussion on the generalizability of the results to other software projects or domains?
